question: A 2 kg ball is rolling at 5 m/s when it is struck by a bat. The ball leaves the bat with a velocity of 10 m/s in the opposite direction. What is the magnitude of the impulse delivered by the bat to the ball?
solution: Impulse is defined as the change in momentum of an object. The initial momentum of the ball is p_i = mv_i = (2 kg)(5 m/s) = 10 kg⋅m/s. The final momentum of the ball is p_f = mv_f = (2 kg)(-10 m/s) = -20 kg⋅m/s. The change in momentum (impulse) is Δp = p_f - p_i = -20 kg⋅m/s - 10 kg⋅m/s = -30 kg⋅m/s. The magnitude of the impulse is |Δp| = 30 kg⋅m/s.
